thread.title: Safe and Convenient Hunting Accessory Invented by InventHelp Clients (JMC-1724)
thread.title_full: Safe and Convenient Hunting Accessory Invented by InventHelp Clients (JMC-1724) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Safe and Convenient Hunting Accessory Invented by InventHelp Clients (JMC-1724)
text:
Founded in 1984 in Pittsburgh, InventHelp is submitting the GUN REST HOLDER to companies in the hopes of a good faith review.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 21, 2015
“We noticed how difficult, awkward and dangerous it can be climbing in and out of a shooting house or tree stand with a loaded gun,” said one of two inventors, from Chunky, Miss. “We thought there could be a safer way, so we invented this.” They invented the patent-pending GUN REST HOLDER.
The GUN REST HOLDER ensures that a hunter’s weapon is readily available and easily accessible. It also eliminates the need to constantly hold the weapon and it prevents the weapon from falling or being dropped. As a result, it enhances safety and it reduces the risk of accidental discharge. The invention features a convenient and portable design that is ideal for use by hunters. Additionally, the GUN REST HOLDER is producible in design variations and a prototype is available.
The inventors described the invention design. “Our design provides a safer, more convenient way to secure the placement of a rifle or shotgun.”
The original design was submitted to the Telemarketing office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-JMC-1724, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
